result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrine J Bullard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive credit for one day served.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular, effective October 26, 2016

Agent Deb Duel contacted office to inform Defendant has paid all court obligations and completed all other conditions of probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016, will be canceled.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
10:08 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to 2015CM94 as charged and will dismiss and read-in 2015CM120.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2015CM94.  Court orders 2015CM120 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

75 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit of one day on 2015CM94.

Court adjourned at 10:19 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-26-2015 09:45 am

10:04 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and need an alternate offer and requests another date.  Court sets for plea & senteneing on October 26, 2015 at 9:45 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:05 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-12-2015 09:45 am

11:02 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant contacted her to inform her he had no transportation this morning.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on October 12, 2015 at 9:45 a.m.  Mandatory appearance.

Court adjourned at 11:03 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-01-2015 10:00 am

2:46 P.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - needs an offer to resolve and requests another hearing.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on September 1, 2015 at 10:00 A.M.

Court adjourned at 2:47 p.m.
Status hearing at 07-21-2015 02:00 pm

3:08 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set both cases for Status Hearing on July 21, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:10 p.m.
